document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Ariptyelus Matsumura (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Ariptyelus Matsumura (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coloration: Eyes yellowish brown, with brown marks; antenna brown; vertex yellowish brown, dark brown centrally, median carina dark brown. Frons in dorsal view dark brown, median carina yellow; frons in ventral view with basal part brown, apical part dark brown, transverse band not recognizable; genae and base of mouth parts dark brown. Pronotum with anterior half yellowish brown, posterior half dark brown. Mesoscutellum yellowish brown. Tegmen (
Fig. 1
A) light brown, apical half with dark brown marks irregularly distributed, transverse band at middle dark brown, darker on costal margin and lighter on cubital area. Hind leg dark brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Tegmen and wing: A,
Ariptyelus arisanus
, tegmen; B,
A. arisanus
, wing; C,
A. auropilosus
, tegmen; D,
A. auropilosus
, wing; ap, apical cell; AM, anal margin; BW, basal widest point; LBW, length from base to basal widest point; LMW, length from basal point to middle widest point; LT, length of tegmen; MW, middle widest point; PM, posterior margin; WCA, wing coupling apparatus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Structure: Head width: body width: body length= 1 : 1.4 : 2.8 . Head in ventral view rhomboid, about 1.4 times wider than median length; about 3.4 times wider at base than median length from dorsal aspect. Pronotum wider than median length at widest part about 1.6 : 1 . Tegmen (
Fig. 1
A) subquadrate, anal margin: posterior margin: length of tegmen = 1 : 2.1 : 4 ; LBW: LMW: LT= 1 : 2.2 : 3.1 . Wings (
Fig. 1
B) with 4 apical cells, apical cells with first one longer than third 1.7 : 1 . Wing coupling apparatus (WCA) with 3 hooks on basal part of costal margin (
Fig. 1
B). Hind tibia with apical spines arranged in 2 rows, upper row with 7 spines, lower one with 8 spines.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Ariptyelus arisanus (Matsumura, 1942)
and
A. auropilosus (Matsumura, 1907)
, males: A, Dorsal view; B. lateral view; C. dorsal view; D. lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male Genitalia: Pygofer subquadrate in lateral view (
Fig. 3
A), wider than long about 1.2 : 1 ; basal margin of pygofer smoothly curved inward; dorsal process of pygofer conelike in lateral view, directed ventrally; ventral process of pygofer in lateral view, shorter than ventral length of pygofer about 1 : 3.7 ; ventral process at widest part narrower than basal wide of pygofer about 1 : 5.3 . Pygofer subquadrate in ventral view (
Fig. 3
B); posterior part produced, platelike, not bilobed, transverse long, apical margin with minute notch at middle. Aedeagus elongate (
Fig. 3
E). Genital styles (
Figs. 3
C, 3 D) with width of apical part about 1.2 times length ( WAGS : LAGS = 1.2 : 1 ) on outer side, margin prominent on caudal margin of inner side.

, and

sp. nov.

Remarks: This species is known only from Taiwan . It is a common species and widespread all over Taiwan in habitats including shady and humid localities from lowland to upland. It can be distinguished easily from the other two
Ariptyelus
species by its size.
